title: Agricultural Produce Distribution and Waste Collection
content: A farm cooperative operates a fleet of refrigerated trucks to deliver fresh produce from a central hub (<loc_depot>) to grocery stores (<loc_customer>). Each store has a unique demand (<demand_linehaul>) for produce, while some stores also have organic waste (<demand_backhaul>) to be collected for composting. Trucks have a strict weight limit (<capacity>) and must complete all deliveries before picking up waste. Drivers end their routes at the last pickup location, reducing unnecessary returns. The goal is to minimize total distance while ensuring no truck is overloaded during deliveries or pickups.

title: Industrial Parts Supplier with Core Returns
content: An auto parts supplier delivers new components (<demand_linehaul>) to repair shops (<loc_customer>) from a warehouse (<loc_depot>), while simultaneously collecting used "core" parts (<demand_backhaul>) for refurbishment. Trucks (<capacity>) must prioritize deliveries before loading cores, and routes remain open—drivers finish at the last core pickup. The challenge is to optimize routes so that all shops receive parts, cores are efficiently retrieved, and total mileage is minimized without exceeding vehicle capacity.

title: E-Commerce Reverse Logistics
content:
A fulfillment center (<loc_depot>) dispatches vans (<capacity>) to deliver online orders (<demand_linehaul>) to customers (<loc_customer>). After deliveries, vans collect returns (<demand_backhaul>) like defective items or unwanted goods. Since drivers are freelancers, they end their shifts after the last return pickup. The system must ensure:  
- Deliveries are completed before returns are collected.  
- No van exceeds capacity during either phase.  
- Total travel distance across all vans is minimized.

title: Laundry Service for Hotels
content: A commercial laundry service picks up dirty linens (<demand_backhaul>) from hotels (<loc_customer>) and delivers clean replacements (<demand_linehaul>) from its facility (<loc_depot>). Vehicles (<capacity>) must first drop off clean linens before loading soiled ones, and routes remain open (no return to depot). The objective is to design routes that serve all hotels while balancing linen supply/demand and minimizing fuel costs, ensuring trucks never exceed capacity during either task.

title: Construction Material Delivery and Debris Removal
content:
A construction company delivers raw materials (<demand_linehaul>) to worksites (<loc_customer>) from a depot (<loc_depot>) using trucks (<capacity>). After unloading, trucks collect demolition debris (<demand_backhaul>) for recycling. Deliveries must precede pickups, and drivers finish at the last debris site. The challenge is to plan routes that:  
- Avoid overloading trucks during material delivery or debris collection.  
- Cover all sites with minimal combined travel distance.  
- Account for varying material/debris volumes per site.

title: Pharmaceutical Delivery and Medical Waste Collection
content: A pharmaceutical company distributes vaccines and medications to clinics (<loc_customer>) from a central warehouse (<loc_depot>). Trucks with capacity <capacity> must deliver all supplies before collecting waste, and drivers end their routes at the last clinic (no return to depot). The goal is to minimize total distance while ensuring no truck exceeds capacity during deliveries or pickups.

title: Aquaculture Harvest and Feed Distribution
content: A seafood farm uses boats (<capacity>) to distribute feed (<demand_linehaul>) to offshore cages (<loc_customer>) from a coastal depot (<loc_depot>). After feeding, boats harvest mature fish (<demand_backhaul>) for processing. Routes must complete feed deliveries before harvests, ending at the processing plant to maximize efficiency.

title: Urban Furniture Rental Logistics
content: A furniture rental company operates a fleet of trucks to deliver rented items (sofas, tables, etc.) to customers and collect returned items from previous rentals. Each truck (capacity `<capacity>`) starts at the warehouse (`<loc_depot>`), delivers new rentals to linehaul customers (`<loc_customer>`, demand `<demand_linehaul>`), then picks up returns from backhaul customers (`<demand_backhaul>`). Drivers end their routes at the last pickup location, avoiding unnecessary returns. The goal is to minimize total distance while ensuring trucks never exceed capacity and deliveries precede pickups.

title: Aquaculture Feed Delivery and Harvest Collection
content: A fish farm supplier delivers feed to aquaculture sites (`<loc_customer>`, demand `<demand_linehaul>`) and collects harvested fish from the same locations (`<demand_backhaul>`). Trucks (capacity `<capacity>`) depart from a processing plant (`<loc_depot>`), prioritize feed deliveries to ensure timely feeding schedules, then load harvested fish for transport. Routes remain open-ended, with trucks staying at the final harvest site for unloading. The challenge is balancing feed delivery and harvest pickup volumes without overloading vehicles.

title: Industrial Gas Cylinder Distribution Network
content: A gas supplier delivers full cylinders to factories (`<loc_customer>`, demand `<demand_linehaul>`) and retrieves empty ones (`<demand_backhaul>`). Each truck (capacity `<capacity>`) starts at the depot (`<loc_depot>`), must deliver all full cylinders before collecting empties, and ends routes at the last pickup point. The goal is to optimize routes to minimize travel distance while ensuring cylinder swaps never exceed truck capacity.

title: Mobile Vet Clinic Animal Transport System
content: A veterinary service transports medical supplies to rural clinics (`<loc_customer>`, demand `<demand_linehaul>`) and brings back rescued animals (`<demand_backhaul>`) for treatment. Vehicles (capacity `<capacity>`) start at the central hospital (`<loc_depot>`), complete all supply drops before loading animals, and remain at the final clinic. The system must prioritize supply deliveries while ensuring animal transport complies with vehicle weight limits.

title: Luxury Fashion Pop-Up Inventory Rotation
content: A high-end fashion brand rotates inventory between pop-up stores (`<loc_customer>`). Trucks (capacity `<capacity>`) depart from a warehouse (`<loc_depot>`), deliver new collections (`<demand_linehaul>`), and retrieve unsold items (`<demand_backhaul>`) in separate phases. Drivers finish routes at the last store, eliminating return trips. The challenge is maximizing route efficiency while adhering to strict capacity limits and ensuring deliveries always precede pickups.

title: Urban Art Installation Logistics
content: A city arts council deploys temporary installations across neighborhoods. Trucks transport sculptures and materials from a central depot (`loc_depot`) to designated sites (`loc_customer`), each requiring unique supplies (`demand_linehaul`). After installations are complete, the same trucks collect dismantled pieces (`demand_backhaul`) for storage. Vehicles (`capacity`) must deliver all items before picking up returns, and drivers end their shifts at the final pickup site (no depot return). The goal is to minimize total distance while ensuring no truck exceeds capacity during deliveries or pickups.

title: Modular Construction Site Support
content: A builder uses prefabricated modules for rapid housing projects. Flatbed trucks (`capacity`) deliver modules from a factory (`loc_depot`) to construction sites (`loc_customer`) with varying needs (`demand_linehaul`). After assembly, trucks retrieve unused materials (`demand_backhaul`) for reuse. Deliveries must precede pickups, and trucks remain on-site after final collections. Routes must optimize fuel use and avoid overloading during either phase.

title: Aquarium Coral Trade Network
content: A marine conservation group coordinates coral shipments between aquariums. Vehicles (`capacity`) transport live coral fragments from a nursery (`loc_depot`) to institutions (`loc_customer`) with specific requests (`demand_linehaul`). Later, they collect expired or overgrown specimens (`demand_backhaul`) for rehabilitation. Deliveries are prioritized, and routes end at the last pickup location. The challenge is balancing fragile cargo loads while minimizing transit time.

title: Reusable Shipping Container Redistribution
content: A logistics firm manages reusable containers for retail clients. Trucks (`capacity`) distribute loaded containers from a hub (`loc_depot`) to stores (`loc_customer`) based on orders (`demand_linehaul`). After unloading, they retrieve empty containers (`demand_backhaul`) from the same stores. Vehicles must complete all deliveries before pickups and finish routes at the final store. The system aims to reduce empty miles and container shortages.

title: Mobile Voting Booth Deployment
content: During elections, a government agency deploys portable voting booths (`demand_linehaul`) from a warehouse (`loc_depot`) to polling stations (`loc_customer`) using vans (`capacity`). Post-election, the same vans collect disassembled booths (`demand_backhaul`) for storage. Deliveries must finish before collections, and vans remain at the last station. Routes must serve all locations efficiently without exceeding vehicle capacity during either phase.

title: Urban Grocery Delivery and Food Bank Collection
content: A grocery chain operates a fleet of electric vans to deliver fresh produce to urban stores (<loc_customer>) from a central warehouse (<loc_depot>), each with a demand (<demand_linehaul>). After deliveries, the vans collect surplus food from stores to donate to food banks (<demand_backhaul>). Vehicles (<capacity>) must complete all deliveries before pickups and can end routes at the last food bank. The goal is to minimize total distance while ensuring no van exceeds capacity during deliveries or returns.

title: Renewable Energy Component Logistics
content: A solar farm installer distributes panels and batteries to residential sites (<loc_customer>) from a depot (<loc_depot>), with each site requiring specific components (<demand_linehaul>). After installations, crews retrieve old batteries for recycling (<demand_backhaul>). Trucks (<capacity>) must deliver all new equipment before collecting old units and can finish routes at the final recycling center. Optimize routes to reduce emissions and avoid overloading.

title: Aquaculture Feed Delivery and Harvest Collection
content: A seafood company delivers feed to fish farms (<loc_customer>) via boats (<capacity>) from a coastal depot (<loc_depot>), with each farm needing a unique feed quantity (<demand_linehaul>). After deliveries, boats collect harvested fish (<demand_backhaul>) for processing. Routes must prioritize feed drops before harvest pickups, and boats can dock at the processing plant without returning to the depot. Minimize fuel costs while respecting weight limits.

title: Modular Construction Site Support
content: A builder transports prefabricated modules to construction sites (<loc_customer>) from a factory (<loc_depot>), with each site requiring modules (<demand_linehaul>). After unloading, trucks (<capacity>) collect reusable scaffolding and materials (<demand_backhaul>). Deliveries must precede pickups, and trucks can end routes at the last collection point. Plan routes to balance load weights and reduce empty mileage.

title: Mobile Vaccination Clinic Logistics
content: A health agency deploys mobile clinics to neighborhoods (<loc_customer>) from a central hub (<loc_depot>), carrying vaccines (<demand_linehaul>) in refrigerated vans (<capacity>). After administering doses, vans collect used syringes and medical waste (<demand_backhaul>). Clinics must finish vaccinations before waste collection and can conclude routes at the final disposal site. Optimize for minimal travel time and strict capacity adherence.

title: Urban Plant Nursery Delivery and Deadstock Collection
content: A city-based plant nursery supplies fresh greenery to offices and cafes (<loc_customer>) from its greenhouse (<loc_depot>), while also collecting wilted plants for composting. Delivery vans (<capacity>) must first distribute new plants (<demand_linehaul>) before collecting expired ones (<demand_backhaul>). Drivers end their routes at the last pickup location to avoid empty return trips. The goal is to maximize greenery distribution while minimizing mileage and ensuring vans never exceed weight limits with combined loads.

title: Film Studio Prop Circulation Network
content: A movie studio's prop warehouse (<loc_depot>) ships period furniture to active film sets (<loc_customer>) and retrieves props from wrapped productions. Trucks (<capacity>) must deliver all requested items (<demand_linehaul>) before gathering returns (<demand_backhaul>), with drivers released after final collections. The challenge lies in coordinating simultaneous multi-set operations without overloading vehicles, especially when handling bulky vintage items.

title: Aquaculture Harvest Distribution and Feed Delivery
content: A seafood farm's processing plant (<loc_depot>) sends live fish to restaurants (<loc_customer>) using refrigerated trucks (<capacity>), then collects empty oxygen tanks from the same locations. Deliveries (<demand_linehaul>) must precede tank retrievals (<demand_backhaul>), with vehicles remaining at last stops near morning markets. Routing must account for strict weight limits due to perishable cargo and cylindrical tank dimensions.

title: Art Exhibition Logistics for Gallery Chain
content: A gallery network's storage hub (<loc_depot>) transports paintings to exhibition spaces (<loc_customer>) and retrieves artworks from closing shows. Climate-controlled trucks (<capacity>) first deliver all loaned pieces (<demand_linehaul>), then carefully pack returns (<demand_backhaul>). Drivers secure vehicles at final pickup locations overnight. The solution must prevent mixed loads (deliveries before pickups) while accommodating fragile cargo space requirements.

title: Reusable Packaging System for Urban Bakeries
content: A central bakery (<loc_depot>) supplies fresh bread to satellite stores (<loc_customer>) while collecting reusable bread baskets. Electric trikes (<capacity>) must complete all bread deliveries (<demand_linehaul>) before loading empty baskets (<demand_backhaul>), with riders finishing shifts at the last collection point. The routing must optimize for tight urban spaces and strict weight limits to prevent trike tip-overs with tall basket stacks.

title: Urban Furniture Rental Logistics
content: A furniture rental company delivers sofas, tables, and chairs to customers across the city (<loc_customer>) from their warehouse (<loc_depot>). Each delivery truck (<capacity>) carries new rentals (<demand_linehaul>) and picks up expired rentals (<demand_backhaul>) in the same trip—but only after all deliveries are complete. The goal is to minimize total distance while ensuring trucks never exceed capacity during either phase.

title: Aquaculture Feed Delivery and Harvest Collection
content: A fish farm operator distributes feed (<demand_linehaul>) to offshore aquaculture cages (<loc_customer>) from a coastal depot (<loc_depot>), then collects harvested fish (<demand_backhaul>) using boats with limited hold space (<capacity>). Routes must prioritize feed deliveries before harvest pickups to avoid spoilage, optimizing for fuel efficiency in open-water navigation.

title: Industrial Gas Cylinder Distribution Network
content: A gas supplier delivers full cylinders (<demand_linehaul>) to factories (<loc_customer>) from a central plant (<loc_depot>), then retrieves empties (<demand_backhaul>) using trucks with strict weight limits (<capacity>). Deliveries must precede pickups to prevent mixing loads, and routes terminate at the last pickup point to reduce deadhead miles.

title: Mobile Vet Clinic Animal Transport System
content: A veterinary service transports medical supplies (<demand_linehaul>) to rural clinics (<loc_customer>) from a hub (<loc_depot>), then brings back rescued animals (<demand_backhaul>) in climate-controlled vans (<capacity>). Vehicles must deliver all supplies before loading animals to avoid cross-contamination, with routes ending at the final rescue site.

title: Luxury Fashion Pop-Up Inventory Rotation
content: A high-end brand circulates seasonal collections (<demand_linehaul>) to temporary pop-up stores (<loc_customer>) from a central atelier (<loc_depot>), then retrieves unsold items (<demand_backhaul>) via armored vans (<capacity>). Deliveries must be completed before pickups to maintain security protocols, with routes optimized for minimal urban travel time.

title: Urban Farm Produce Delivery and Compost Collection
content: A city-based urban farm operates a fleet of electric vans to deliver fresh produce to local restaurants and grocery stores while collecting organic waste for composting. Each van has a limited capacity (<capacity>) and starts from the farm (<loc_depot>). Deliveries (linehauls: <demand_linehaul>) must be completed before collecting compost (backhauls: <demand_backhaul>). Drivers end their routes at the last pickup location, reducing unnecessary trips back to the farm. The goal is to minimize total distance while ensuring no van is overloaded during deliveries or pickups.

title: Mobile Vaccination Clinic and Medical Waste Disposal
content: A healthcare provider deploys mobile clinics to administer vaccines in underserved neighborhoods (<loc_customer>). Each clinic vehicle (<capacity>) carries vaccines (linehauls: <demand_linehaul>) from a central depot (<loc_depot>) and later collects used syringes/medical waste (backhauls: <demand_backhaul>). Vehicles do not return to the depot after the last waste pickup, instead parking at designated storage sites. Routes must prioritize vaccine delivery before waste collection while respecting vehicle capacity constraints.

title: Reusable Packaging Logistics for Meal Kit Subscriptions
content: A meal kit company uses reusable insulated boxes for deliveries. Trucks (<capacity>) depart from a distribution center (<loc_depot>) to deliver fresh meal kits (linehauls: <demand_linehaul>) to subscribers and retrieve empty boxes from previous deliveries (backhauls: <demand_backhaul>). Drivers finish routes at the last box pickup location. The challenge is to sequence deliveries before pickups while optimizing routes to reduce mileage and avoid exceeding box capacity during either phase.

title: Film Festival Equipment Distribution and Return Logistics
content: A film festival organization coordinates the delivery of projectors, screens, and audio equipment to venues (<loc_customer>) from a central warehouse (<loc_depot>). After screenings, crews must retrieve equipment (backhauls: <demand_backhaul>) using the same trucks (<capacity>). Vehicles are not required to return to the warehouse after the last pickup. The goal is to plan routes where all deliveries precede pickups, ensuring no truck exceeds weight limits during either task.

title: Industrial Tool Rental Fleet Redistribution
content: A tool rental company manages a network of construction sites (<loc_customer>) that require specialized equipment deliveries (linehauls: <demand_linehaul>) and returns (backhauls: <demand_backhaul>). Flatbed trucks (<capacity>) start from a maintenance hub (<loc_depot>), deliver tools to active sites, then collect overdue rentals—always completing deliveries before pickups. Drivers end routes at the final pickup location. The system must balance tool availability across sites while minimizing deadhead mileage and respecting load limits.
